page.title: 06POPULATION:FENNY COMPTON.
page.content: The present population within the grid area is about 500 people, and consists of an aging population with decreasing numbers of young families. Council houses meant to house families of from 5 to 6 now house one or two old people and many larger houses with room for 6 - 10 occupants have only one or two. There is a shifting population of younger people moving in and out of the more expensive houses -commuters come and go as their work moves them about the country.Each time a house changes hands,the price rises by a few more thousand pounds, and less well-offfamilies are priced out of the village.But those who move into the grid area tend from town situations tend to settle comfortably into the life and rhythm of the village and usually make valuable contributions to village life,activities and affairs.
